refnamediv.refpurpose: Map a DNS domain to a location

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: The aq map dns domain command maps a DNS domain to a location. This mapping is used to construct the default DNS search path.

The DNS search path for a given machine is constructed by walking the location tree, starting from the machine's physical location and moving from each node to its parent. At every step, the DNS domains mapped to the given location are appended to the list. If a DNS domain appears multiple times in the list, only the first occurrence is retained, any further occurrences are removed.
The show_dns_domain1 command will show the locations a particular DNS domain is mapped to.

Changes in the DNS search path due to changes in the domain mapping take effect only when the machine's plenary template is updated. Use the flush1 command to force an update of the machine templates.
Note that the Quattor templates may also alter the DNS search path; such changes are not known to the broker.

listitem.para: The DNS domain to map to the specified location.
The position of DOMAIN in the list of domains mapped to the same location, if there are more than one such domains. The numbering starts from zero.

example.title: Set the DNS search path
example.programlisting: aq map dns domain --dns_domain other.ms.com --building np aq map dns domain --dns_domain one-nyp.ms.com --building np --position 0 aq map dns domain --dns_domain new-york.ms.com --city ny
example.para: The above commands will cause any hosts in the np building to look up unqualified names first in the one-nyp.ms.com, then in the other.ms.com domain, and finally in the new-york.ms.com domain. Other hosts in New York outside the np building will search the new-york.ms.com domain only.
